titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1215) to improve patient access to health care services and provide improved medical care by reducing the excessive burden the liability system places on the health care delivery system.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1215) to improve patient access to health care services and provide improved medical care by reducing the excessive burden the liability system places on the health care delivery system.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-179, by Mr. Burgess.

The resolution makes in order as original text for purpose of amendment an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-10. The resolution makes in order only those amendments printed in the report.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 57.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 382.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 184 (Roll no. 325).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 235 - 186 (Roll no. 326).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1215) to improve patient access to health care services and provide improved medical care by reducing the excessive burden the liability system places on the health care delivery system.
